displaytitle: Study for St. John the Baptist in the Wilderness
medium: Pen and brown ink with brush and brown wash over traces of black chalk, on tan laid paper, squared in black chalk
creditline: Gift of Frank Jewett Mather Jr.
markings: Inscribed verso, lower center, on mount in red graphite canceled out: Carlo Coppola/ 289; inscribed verso, lower right, on mount in brown ink: Salvator Rosa

displaymaker: Massimo Stanzione, Italian, ca. 1585–ca. 1656 | formerly school of Salvator Rosa, 1615–1673; born Naples, Italy; died Rome, Italy
caption: Massimo Stanzione (Italian, ca. 1585–ca. 1656), formerly school of Salvator Rosa (1615–1673; born Naples, Italy; died Rome, Italy), Study for St. John the Baptist in the Wilderness, ca. 1633-35. Pen and brown ink with brush and brown wash over traces of black chalk, on tan laid paper, squared in black chalk; 19.9 × 12.6 cm. Gift of Frank Jewett Mather Jr. (x1952-171)
